page.title: 11THE FERRY TO THE MAINLAND
page.content: Our ferry is the{Hendra.}We got it in 1982.But before that,up to 1975,we had the{Earl of Zetland.}Each week it made 3 runs up from Lerwick and 3 back also going to Unst,Yell & Fetlar.It had a crane for loading/unloading all cars & freight. In 1975 the ro-ro ferry{Fylga}was based here.At first it ran to Lerwick until the ramps at Laxo and Vidlin were built.The Fylga could take 12 cars across the sound in 35mins.,50 mins.to Vidlin in bad S.E. weather. The Hendra replaced the Fylga,can take 18 cars and crosses in 25-30mins. There is a crew of 4 who all live on Whalsay.The Hendra makes 6 return trips each day,starting out from Whalsay at 6.45am,the last run from the mainland to Whalsay at 6.00pm. In summer there are some extra runs in the evening.
